titleStmt.title: The memoires of Mr. James Wadswort [sic], a Jesuit that recanted discovering a dreadful prospect of impiety, in the blasphemous doctrines (or Gospel) of the Jesuits, with their atheistical lives and conversations / faithfully published to the world out of the authors own original notes, with the particular places, persons, and circumstantial actions &c., of which he himself was both an eye and ear-witness from time to time.
titleStmt.author: Wadsworth, James, 1604-1656?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Henry Hills for Henry Brome ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
